question: Gamma Rays Are used in which Diagnostic Modality?
exp: Gamma Rays are used in Radioisotope studies/scintigraphy studies Bone scan is a radioisotope study done using Tc99m -MDP to detect skeletal metastasis Fluoroscopy and CT scan uses Xrays Radiowaves are used in MRI

question: The technique employed in radiotherapy to counteract the effect of tumour motion due to breathing is known as
exp: Gating Respiratory gating: It is a technique in radiotherapy in which the radiation is applied during that phase of respiratory cycle in which the tumour is in the best range. This is to prevent unnecessary radiation exposure to normal structures.

question: Intraoperative Radiotherapy for treating pancreatic carcinoma mainly uses
exp: Electron Beam is preferred for intraoperative Radiotherapy. The Intraoperative radiotherapy (IO) appears to be an ideal therapeutic strategy for pancreatic cancer, Having the advantage of enabling the delivery of high doses of radiation to areas that are at risk for microscopic disease, saving critical organs and reducing the possibility of inducing radiotoxicity.

question: Radioisotope study preferred for detection of parathyroid adenoma is?
exp: Sestamibi Scan Is preferred isotope study used for Parathyroid Adenoma I-131 is used for Systemic Radiotherapy of Thyroid Cancers Thallium-201 scan is used for Myocardial Perfusion Tc99m-MDP/Medronate is used for Bone scan

question: All among the following radioisotope are used as permanent implant except:
exp: Caesium-137 is not used as permanent implant for Brachytherapy Permanent implants for brachytherapy Iodine-125 Palladium-103 Gold-198 Caesium-131

question: Intracranial Irradiation most commonly leads to deficiency of
exp: *Growth Hormone is most radiosensitive pituitary hormone and intracranial irradiation leads to hypopituitarism mainly due to hypothalamic damage rather than pituitary damage *Least radiosensitive pituitary hormone is TSH

question: Which of the following tumor is radiosensitive?
exp: RADIOSENSITIVE TUMORS: WILM'S TUMOR EWING'S SARCOMA LYMPHOMA SEMINOMA MULTIPLE MYELOMA MEDULLOBLASTOMA PINEALOBLASTOMA RADIORESISTANT TUMOR: MELANOMA OSTEOSARCOMA PANCREATIC CARCINOMA

question: Electron Beam Radiotherapy is used in treatment of?
exp: Electron Beam Radiotherapy MC used for Intraopeive Used for Superficial Cancers like Mycosis Fungoides. Tumours of Eyelids & lips Skull Base Chordomas/Deep Seated Brain Tumors are usually treated by Proton Beam Radiotherapy

question: Which of the following is used in External Beam Radiotherapy?
exp: External Beam Radiotherapy(EB/TELETHERAPY) is done using C0-60/Cs-137 which produce Gamma Rays Nowadays EB/TELETHERAPY is usually done using Linear Accelerator/LINAC which uses Xrays

question: Half life of cobalt-60 is -
exp: Impoant Radioisotopes Half Life RADIOISOTOPE HALF LIFE IODINE 131 8 DAYS IODINE 125 60 DAYS IODINE 124 4 DAYS IODINE 123 13 HOURS PHOSPHORUS -32 14 DAYS RADIUM (RA-226) 1622 years Cobalt -60 5. 2 years Cesium - 137 30 years TC- 99m 6 hours Iridium (Ir-192) 74. 5 Days 18F (18. FDG) 110 min Strontium 89 50. 5 days

question: Which among the following is/are pure beta emitter(s):
exp: Pure Beta Emitters: Strontium-89 Phosphorus -32, Ytterium-90

question: Most Common Method Of Radiotherapy is?
exp: Most Common Method of Radiotherapy is External Beam Radiotherapy/Teletherapy
